definition: to fail the imperial exams/to flunk
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees
to row/oar/Taiwan pr. [beng4]
to whip/Taiwan pr. [beng4]

sentences.english: So you failed the college entrance exam. You've plenty of company.
sentences.chinese: 那麼你是大學聯考落榜羅，不過不只是你一個人。

sentences.english: And talent as a friend to pass him, and he has failed the Wets .
sentences.chinese: 而才華不如他的朋友考取了，而他這位才子竟落榜。

sentences.english: I want her to take the college exam again.
sentences.chinese: 去年她考大學落榜，我要她重考。

sentences.english: I was informed that she was very industrious but failed in the CollegeEntrance Examination last year.
sentences.chinese: 後來得知她雖然很勤奮，但是去年高考不幸落榜。

sentences.english: He lost patience when he failed to get into college for the 4th time.
sentences.chinese: 當第4次落榜的時候，他失去了耐心。

sentences.english: But ministers relented on this because of concern over drop-out rates.
sentences.chinese: 但是部長卻因爲擔心造成高落榜率而放寬標準。

sentences.english: He failed in the college entrance examination by carelessness.
sentences.chinese: 由於粗心，他今年高考落榜了。

sentences.english: I learnt from her mother that she failed in the College Entrance Examination last year. Even so, she never gave up and was encouraged to go on studying hard and try again.
sentences.chinese: 從她母親那兒，我得知她去年高考落榜了。

sentences.english: Can you tell me what you learned from the experience of not succeeding?
sentences.chinese: 你能否說說看，那次落榜的經驗，帶給你什麼？

sentences.english: I came here just to have a rest because I failed in the college entrance examination.
sentences.chinese: 我來這裏僅僅是想散散心，因爲我高考落榜了。

sentences.english: Hearing that she failed again, she is exceedingly gloomy.
sentences.chinese: 又一次落榜了，她的心情陰晦到了極點。

sentences.english: Therefore, more students in the examination exam and got the opportunity to attend vocational schools.
sentences.chinese: 因此，更多的中考落榜生得到了就讀職業學校的機會。

sentences.english: And da few familiar faces return to the list after falling from its ranks in previous years.
sentences.chinese: 還有一些去年落榜的老面孔今年重新回到了富豪榜。

definition: lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
to fail to be chosen (or elected)/to lose an election
to pass a university entrance exam
to accept an applicant (prospective student, employee etc) who passes an entrance exam/to admit (a student)/to hire (a job candidate)
to gain entry by passing an exam/to be admitted to (a college etc)

top scorer in the palace examination (highest rank of the Imperial examination system)/see 榜眼[bang3 yan3] and 探花[tan4 hua1]/top scorer in college entrance examination 高考[gao1 kao3]/(fig.) the most brilliantly talented person in the field/leading light

college entrance exam (especially as abbr. for 普通高等學校招生全國統一考試|普通高等学校招生全国统一考试[Pu3 tong1 Gao1 deng3 Xue2 xiao4 Zhao1 sheng1 Quan2 guo2 Tong3 yi1 Kao3 shi4])/(Tw) entrance exam for senior government service posts (abbr. for 公務人員高等考試|公务人员高等考试)
to return to the same school and repeat a course from which one has already graduated, as a result of failing to get good enough results to progress to one's desired higher-level school
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
to pass the provincial level imperial examination
to publish a roll-call of successful candidates
to win top marks in the imperial examinations
metropolitan examination (imperial civil service examination)
to pass an entrance exam/to be admitted to
to enter oneself for an examination
unified examination
